meanings.definition: The action of interpreting something in a new or different way.
meanings.sent1: Her reinterpretations of the classic stories brought fresh perspectives to the audience.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often engage in reinterpretations of historical events to uncover new insights.
meanings.sent3: The reinterpretations of the fairy tales made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: His reinterpretations of reality turned the mundane into something extraordinary.
meanings.sent5: The artist's reinterpretations of nature were vibrant and full of life.

meanings.definition: A new or different interpretation of something.
meanings.sent1: The art exhibit showcased various reinterpretations of traditional paintings.
meanings.sent2: Literary critics debated the merits of the different reinterpretations of the novel.
meanings.sent3: The reinterpretations of the song lyrics added a playful twist to the music.
meanings.sent4: In her reinterpretations of fashion trends, she always stood out from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The reinterpretations of the recipe gave it a modern flair while keeping its essence.
